齘字的基本解释

齘
xiè
牙齿相磨切。
（物体上下交接处）参差不吻合。

齘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiè］
［《廣韻》胡介切，去怪，匣。］
(1)牙齿相摩切。
(2)引申为交切。
(3)愁貌。

齘字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【齒字部】　齘； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页1533第03
【唐韻】胡介切【集韻】【韻會】下介切【正韻】下戒切，?音械。【說文】齒相切也。【玉篇】䫴齘者，切齒怒也。【廣雅】馮齘，怒也。　又【正韻】齒齘，齒上下相抵處。【周禮·冬官考工記函人】凡甲衣之欲其無齘也。【註】齘，謂如齒齘。【疏】札葉參差相似。

Basic explanation of words
Long
xiè
The teeth are cut to each other.
(The upper and lower junctions of the objects) are uneven.
Long
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiè］
["Guangyun" Hu Jieqie, go to blame, Xia. ]
(1) The teeth are touching each other.
(2) The extension is crosscutting.
(3) Sad appearance.
Long
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Ji 2] [Tooth Word Department] 　齘; Kangxi strokes: 19; Page number: page 1533 No. 03
[Tang Yun] Hu Jieqie [Jiyun] [Rhyme Meeting] Xiajieqie [Zhengyun] Quit cutting, sound equipment. [Said the text] The teeth are also tangent. 【Jade articles】Those who are stubbornly grinning teeth are also angry. [Guang Ya] Feng Jian, angry too.　[Zheng Yun] The teeth are short, and the teeth meet up and down. [Zhou Li·Dongguan Kao Gongji Letter] The desire of all armor and clothing is also impeccable. 【Note】Jian, that is, like a tooth. 【Sparse】The leaves are uneven and similar.
